runs.comm: off the pads for a leg bye
gets some sharp movement and bounce from off stump, beats the outside edge comfortably
Guptill thwacks a length delivery, finds the gap, and once that is done, it'll only be a boundary on this ground
he bowls it fuller on the stumps, and it disappears straight down the ground, just stood there and golf-swung it over the bowler's head
and another one, this time Razzaq strays down the pads, and Guptill helps it on its way past fine leg for a boundary

much better, they need more of these, it was a back of a length ball that was closing in on off, he stayed in the crease to try and steer it, but it rolled away in the direction of point, hardly had any room there
gives Ryder a short of a good length on the pads, and he tucks it past short fine leg for a boundary
another one, well almost, it was a similar delivery on the hips, and Ryder had beaten short fine, but this time deep square leg ran across and prevented the boundary
take that! it was short, Guptill was expecting it, stayed back and lifted it over deep midwicket for six
outside off on a length, steered down to third man
goes for the carve through covers, but does not get the timing on that one, and the ball rolls away to cover

gone! Shoaib strikes in his first over, poor shot really, it was a shortish ball going across Ryder, who looked to play it towards midwicket with an angled bat, the edge fairly flew to Younis Khan at widish slip, who doesn't drop many in that region, and he took the chest-high chance cleanly
and bowls one back of a length into the body, and it is played square on the leg side for a single
misses out on the pull as a pacy delivery strikes him high on the pads, they appeal for the leg before, but the height and the angle would have taken it over the stumps, and down the the leg side

ooh! this one beats everything, it cut the batsman in half as it came back i nwith the angle, just missed the stumps, and beat Umar Akmal who put in the dive to his left but couldn't get to it in time

the length is right but Gul strays on the pads with the line, and it is swatted past square leg for a boundary, couldn't believe my eyes when I saw it crossing the ropes, but seeing is believing, there was hardly any power on that shot
worked square for a single
tap and run, plays this one with soft hands in front of cover, and off they go
Guptill is lifting the short ones over deep midwicket with the utmost ease, despatches another one in that region, Shoaib needs to do something about that length
good batting this, blocks one in the on side near the wicket and the quick single is taken

he tries to do a Guptill, but Shoaib is too quick for him, and the attempted pull of a shortish pacy delivery, goes to Umar Akmal who takes an excellent diving catch low to his left, moved really quickly there
defended into the off side

short and wide Shoaib sprays it, and Styris uppercuts it over backward point for a boundary, Shoaib can't believe it, don't know what, the fact that he sprayed it wide or the fact that it went for four
good comeback from the bowler, makes one come in with the angle, and Styris is cut in half, had no clue about that one
punched down to deepish mid on for a single
sharp work from Younis at slip, it was played late and almost went past him, as he put in the dive and saved what could have been a boundary
played towards midwicket for a run
takes a step forward and works this one with the turn wide of mid on, and they take on the fielder for a single, and make it easily in the end
angles it across Styris from round the stump, he tries to steer it but is beaten
cramps him for room with one on middle and leg, he goes for the sweep and is hit on the pads, they take a leg bye as it rolls away behind the stumps on the on side

the aeroplane takes off at Eden Park, Shoaib has three, 145 kph fullish delivery homing in off stump, Styris backs away and goes for an ill-advised hoick, and hears the death rattle behind him, poor shot really, Shoaib was too quick for him
143 kph length delivery outside the off stump, comes in a tad after pitching, Taylor wisely leaves it alone, this is still one of the best sights in cricket, watching Shoaib steaming in
taps this one on off stump towards extra cover, and gets off the mark with a single
nothing Guptill can do with this one, short of a good length and right into the body, no room to do anything but defend it back down the track
gets hold of it this time, swings a length delivery cleanly but finds mid on in the way
goes for the swat-pull to a ball that was not short enough, but still gets it down to deep square leg who loses the ball for an instant before fielding it cleanly in the end
creams this full delivery off the middle of the bat straight down the pitch, but Riaz gets a hand to it, and saves a certain boundary, there is no way that can be called a chance though
played off the back foot towards extra cover
steers a length delivery going across him down to squarish third man
in the corridor outside off stump, and even in this format that is a zone of uncertainty, Guptill was not sure what to do with it, and played it out to point in the end
swings a length delivery across the line, just beats midwicket, and you know the result once that happens
poor line, serves up one back of a length on the pads, and Guptill helps it past short fine leg for another boundary
floats one up on the stumps, he comes forward and gets an inside edge square on the leg side
driven wide of long off where Shoaib runs across and keeps them to a single
on the money, and played back to the bowler
looks to break free, but cannot beat the offside field
this time he manages to beat the field, it was short, a long hop really, and he pulled it past midwicket and beat the two men in the deep as well
gets an inside edge wide of midwicket as he gets forward and looks to drive past cover
and is lifted first ball over long on for a six, got to the pitch and lifted it cleanly
leans forward and drives past extra cover to bring up his half century
punched down to long on off the back foot
worked towards square leg
goes back and looks to work it away but hits it straight to midwicket
cramps him with a full delivery on the stumps, swings it back to the bowler on the bounce
driven down to long on
drives past point on one knee and the fielder at sweeper cover runs across but they have enough time to take two
plays it in front of cover for another single

and a wicket falls against the run of play, it was tapped into the off side, and Guptill went rushing down the track for the run, Taylor rightly didn't want it as the fielder was already swooping down on the ball, Guptill backpedalled furiously and put in the dive, but replays show he cold not beat the throw, and was just short of the crease, what an end to a fine knock

floats one up that goes across Franklin, he had a poke at it and was beaten, the forward movement took his back leg outside the crease, good work from Umar who had the bails off in a flash, and replays show the foot was on the line when the bails were dislodged, or was it, it was to close to call, and Franklin survives, getting the benefit of doubt
tosses one up in the air, he reaches out and drives it back to Afridi, who threatens to throw the ball back at Franklin
gets one to straighten on leg stump, and he works it to short fine for a single
reaches out to drive a flighted ball to point
flatter and quicker, gets some turn this time, and it goes in the air back to the bowler
he goes for the cut to one that was to close for the shot, and gets it just past Younis at slip, wold have been a great take had he pulled that one off
worked square on the leg side
tosses one up, and Taylor works it on the bounce to midwicket, there were shouts of 'catch it' but he was safe
poor delivery from Afridi, short and wide outside off, this time Franklin plays the cut cleanly and gets it in the gap past backward point
worked away to deep square leg
leaves this flighted delivery outside off stump alone
hit away to sweeper cover for a single
goes for the cut again, but is beaten this time, as Afridi bowls it a touch flatter and quicker
driven towards long on for a single
makes him reach out and go for the drive, beats him, but can't find the edge, Umar takes off the bails, he has kept well today
driven down the ground for a single
gets across and gets into a tangle as this ball skids on to him and hits him high on the oads
again he gets across and looks to work it past midwicket, but Afridi there is alert and Taylor has to hurry back in the end as the throw is fired in
finds Afridi in the way yet again, and is sent back by Franklin
three in three, he just cannot get it past Afridi at midwicket
pitching outside leg stump, and going across Franklin with the angle, gets an outside edge that rolls away to wide slip
bowls one down the pads, and it is called a wide, for once Umar fails to take it cleanly
short of a good length delivery, dabbed away towards point
Franklin break free, it was short, he saw it early, and went for the pull, it was not exactly off the middle off the bat, but still went way over the deep midwicket boundary
almost carried to third man on the short boundary, it was a thick outside edge as Franklin looked to swing it into cow corner
misses out on a wide delivery, cuts fiercely but straight to backward point
better line from Umar, length ball on the stump, but New Zealand are well in control, and a push wide of mid on brings another single
flat on the stumps, played out to midwicket
tucks him up for room again, and runs past the non-striker to field the ball as it is punched down the track
gets it down to long on this time for a single

gone! it was fast and flat, coming in sharply with the arm, Franklin backed away to cut, but even as the bat was coming down, the ball had crashed into the pads first in front of middle and leg, and umpire Billy thought about it for some time before sending Franklin on his way with the crooked finger
good bowling, the one that goes straight on outside off stump, he looks to cut it but is beaten as it does not turn
played back to the bowler, end of a good over, can Pakistan make something out of it?
slashes hard at a wide delivery, and at Shoaib's pace, it carries over a diving third man all the way for a six, would you believe it?
Taylor leans into the drive, and gets it right out of the middle of the bat, the ball bounces over extra cover, and long off ends up escorting it past the ropes
leaves this one outside off stump alone
gets forward and opens the blade to steer a length ball past backward point
defends a back of a length ball down to deepish mid off, doesn't need to do much now
142 kph but wide outside off stump, and left alone easily
fires it down the leg side, and Umar had no chance to collect that one
works this full delivery away to midwicket
turned to midwicket, cannot get the single
gets one this time, waits for this delivery to turn into him and works it backward of square
another one is fired flat and quick down the leg side, poor bowling this
the Taylor slog sweeps arrives finally, gets one in the slot, he goes down on a knee and swings it over deep midwicket, good clean hit
worked away square on the leg side
gets another one in the slot, this one is a touch fuller, and Tayor takes a step down the track and lifts it over wide long on, New Zealand are almost home
McGlashan does not leave it to Taylor, brings out the reverse sweep and gets it well over the infield over point, er, square leg for a boundary, and New Zealand finally, finally have a win in months
